transcripts.text: Hi, my name is John.  I'm here exclusively to make sure people don't get hurt, and if they do, I'm here to help.  That's all I want out of this entire situation.  Earlier today, I was at the Nicollet and Lake Street Kmart parking lot where we had established a medical pavilion.  We had multiple different medical bays waiting for any injuries to come our way.  Around what time do you think?

They started marching down the street towards the Kmart.  Was it sunset?  Pre-sunset in the evening, the police began to march up Nicollet at us, dispersing the protest.  By the time they got near us, we announced ourselves as medics for about five minutes.  They began to launch rubber bullets and tear gas into our facility.

It was just us medics.  Exclusively medics and those who had been wounded, where we were catering to their needs.  After that, we had to evacuate that area.  Fortunately, everybody was able to get out, and anybody who was wounded was able to be moved to a different location.
And you all got out, and then what happened in the parking lot?

In the parking lot, the police, the National Guard, any other, I can't say that I rightfully know exactly who was there, occupied the space, knocking down any of the barriers we had created around our medical facility.  We've been unable to check on it since.  We came back out after dark to try and see if we could reestablish the med bay.  We were unable to get back there because of the amount of police officers surrounding Kmart, Nicollet, Lake Street, and the Fifth Precinct.

and as we've been walking people have been coming by and people are trapped.  they're trying to get out but they went back to kmart and all their tires are slashed and that was on multiple occasions.  multiple people were like well we're stuck here now and so we gave.  i just told them to stay in the dark shadows and avoid the streets as much as possible but people are stuck due to slash tires.

we just told them to hunker down for the night see if they can get out in the morning.  Once again, we're just medics and we're just trying to help people who get injured, trying to make sure everything's as peaceful as possible.
